name: ThanhVu Nguyen
content: Roars Lab Welcome to ROARS (Research on Automated Reasoning Systems) Lab at George Mason University. We develop automated reasoning techniques to analyze and verify software and AI systems. See Research for more information. This webapp tracks of upcoming CS conferences 4/2025: (Book) Demystifying PhD Admissions in Computer Science is now published and available through Amazon Kindle (the book pdf will always be free through GitHub) 4/2025: Two ISSTA'25 tool papers on LSP support for the COOL language (ğŸ‘ Linhan, first paper) and VS Code support for invariant generation and symbolic execution (ğŸ‘ Stefania, first paper) 4/2025: Elevated to IEEE Senior Member. 4/2025: CAV'25 paper on the NeuralSAT DNN verification tool (ğŸ‘ Hai) 2/2025: TSE paper (50th Anniversary Special Issue) on Evolution of APR 2/2025: ğŸ… TSE 10-Year Retrospective Most Influential Paper Award for GenProg work on automatic program repair (with Claire, Wes, and Steph) 1/2025: NeuralSAT ranked 2nd overall in VNN-COMP'24 (our second participation, ğŸ‘ Hai). Press: UNL 3/2020: KimHao (freshman) joined as an undergraduate researcher 1/2020: Alexey joined as an M.S. student 9/2019: OOPSLA'19 research paper on using algebraic specifications to aid program synthesis 9/2019: Didier joined as a Ph.D. student 6/2019: ğŸ…ğŸ… Received an ACM SIGSOFT 10-year Most Influential Paper Award at ICSE (Software Engr) on program repair. Also an ACM SIGEVO 10-year Impact Award at GECCO (Evolutionary Computing) on using genetic programming to fix bugs 3/2019: PLDI'19 research paper on dynamic invariant inference in separation logic (ğŸ‘ Guolong) 1/2019: ğŸ Received a 3-year grant from the Army Research Office to work on program errors prediction and avoidance People Lab activities/photos ThanhVu Nguyen (PI, faculty) Long Doan (Ph.D. student) Hai Duong (Ph.D. student) Didier Ishimwe (Ph.D. student) Nguyen Ho (Ph.D. student) Linhan Li (Ph.D. student) Phu Le (NSF REU undergraduate) Azan Rasul (NSF REU undergraduate) Stefania Piciorea (undergraduate) Alumni KimHao Nguyen (B.S., graduated 2023, Jump Trading) Guolong Zheng (Ph.D., graduated 2022, Minjiang University) Alexey Malyshev (M.S., graduated 2021, Oracle) Interested in joining our lab? Read "Should you contact a US professor? How to do so correctly?" from the CS PhD Admission Demystify Handbook. Also read about our lab culture and GMU CS dept. Contribute to our open-source projects, e.g., an easy one to work on is csconfs---a webapp to track CS conferences. You can creating Github issues and pull requests for the project. This shows you're serious about working with us and allows us to evaluate your skills. Awards Lab's Best Paper Award at SSBSE'25 Research Spotlight at NeurIPS'25 NeuralSAT ranked 2nd overall in VNN-COMP'25 Outstanding Teaching Assistants Award 2025 (Linhan@GMU) NeuralSAT ranked 2nd overall in VNN-COMP'24 Outstanding Undergraduate Research Award 2024 (Stefania@GMU) NeuralSAT received the New Participant Award at VNN-COMP'23 Outstanding Undergraduate Senior Award 2023 (KimHao@UNL) Outstanding Undergraduate Researcher Award 2021 (KimHao@UNL) PI's IEEE TSE Most Influential Paper Award (50th Anniversary Retrospective) 2025 Amazon Research Award (Automated Reasoning) 2023 NSF CAREER Award 2023 NSF CISE Research Initiation Initiative (CRII) Award 2020 ACM SIGEVO 10-year Impact Paper Award 2019 ACM SIGSOFT / IEEE TCSE ICSE 10-year Most Influential Paper Award 2019 Press Release Amazon Research Award Win for AI Safety Verification: GMU press release on the ARA Boom crash: Mason researcher receives half million NSF grant that could steer AI safely: GMU press release on CAREER award Tiáº¿n sÄ© gá»‘c Viá»‡t Ä‘Æ°á»£c tÃ i trá»£ nghiÃªn cá»©u AI: from Thanh Nien, a Vietnamese news outlet CRII Award: UNL press release on NSF CRII award UNL press release on ACM SIGSOFT 10-year Most Influential Paper Award at ICSE Research Software Engineering; Formal Methods; Automated Reasoning; Program Analysis; Program Verification; AI Safety and Robustness, Dynamic and Static Analysis; SMT/SAT Solving Safe and Robust AI: we are exploring scalable and precise techniques to formally analyze and verify deep neural networks (DNNs). Examples: DPLL(T)-based DNN Verification Program Analysis and Invariants Discovery: we have developed dynamic, static, and symbolic techniques to analyze program semantics and to discover and prove interesting properties. Examples: discovering nonlinear polynomial invariants using dynamic analysis (ICSE Distinguished Paper Award); discovering heap-based memory properties using separation logic; generating program interactions in highly-configurable software using decision trees Fault Localization and Automated Program Repair: we have developed techniques and tools to automatically identify code region responsible program bugs and modify existing or creating new code to repair the bugs. Examples: C program repair using symbolic testing and genetic programming (10-year ICSE Most Influential Paper Award); localizing faults in model specifications using counterexamples Software CSConfs: a webapp to track upcoming CS c
